It is characterized by its round, fleshy leaves that are adapted to arid environments, allowing it to conserve water efficiently. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white, which are pollinated by wind or insects. Schizocodon rotundifolius thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, coastal or mountainous habitats.
